review_text: I enjoyed my 2-night stay at Olen's place in late April. It was clean as a whistle, private, comfortable, and very peaceful. His directions to me, along with help from my GPS, were spot-on, which was important since I arrived after dark. If you're unfamiliar with Athens, I'll tell you that the entrance to Olen's subdivision is off the Jefferson Highway, just a few miles outside the bypass. It's worth noting that the house is in the very back of the subdivision, and it is among the nicest houses in the subdivision. Once I looked at the pictures and again confirmed I was at the right address, I pulled right in and parked just a few feet from the door. I didn't have any problem backing down the driveway in the morning. From Olen's, it's no more than 15-20 minutes to the heart of the UGA campus, which is what brings most folks to Athens anyway. I wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.
